formulas.title: Formula (extracted LaTeX)
formulas.latex: \{(L_i, U_i, r_i)\} = \text{bracket lower bound, upper bound, and rate for your filing status}
formulas.raw: \{(L_i, U_i, r_i)\} = \text{bracket lower bound, upper bound, and rate for your filing status}

formulas.title: Formula (extracted LaTeX)
formulas.latex: r_{\text{marginal}} = r_j \quad \text{for the bracket } j \text{ that contains } I
formulas.raw: r_{\text{marginal}} = r_j \quad \text{for the bracket } j \text{ that contains } I

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: $$ Tax = \sum_{i=1}^{n} r_i \cdot \max\!\left(0,\; \min\!\left(I,\; U_i\right) - L_i \right) $$ where: $$ I = \text{Kansas taxable income} $$ $$ \{(L_i, U_i, r_i)\} = \text{bracket lower bound, upper bound, and rate for your filing status} $$ Marginal rate: $$ r_{\text{marginal}} = r_j \quad \text{for the bracket } j \text{ that contains } I $$ Effective rate: $$ r_{\text{effective}} = \frac{Tax}{I} \quad (\text{defined as } 0 \text{ if } I = 0) $$

variables.meaning: property tax (annual or monthly depending on input)
